intro: Phyllanthus xylorrhizus, commonly known as the Indian mallow or wild mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along riverbanks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
